trans-unit.source: Xenko 3.1 release notes
trans-unit.target: Xenko 3.1 release notes

trans-unit.source: November 11th, 2019
trans-unit.target: November 11th, 2019

trans-unit.source: Highlights
trans-unit.target: Highlights

trans-unit.source: Xenko 3.1 loves NuGet!
trans-unit.target: Xenko 3.1 loves NuGet!

trans-unit.source: Xenko was always a big proponent of NuGet: since first version, Xenko was distributed as a NuGet package.
trans-unit.target: Xenko was always a big proponent of NuGet: since first version, Xenko was distributed as a NuGet package.

trans-unit.source: However, due to limitations (hello packages.config and project.json!), we were leveraging NuGet more as a distribution medium than proper NuGet packages: Xenko 3.0 is still a monolithic single package and it would not work out of the box when referenced from Visual Studio without using Xenko Launcher and Game Studio.
trans-unit.target: However, due to limitations (hello packages.config and project.json!), we were leveraging NuGet more as a distribution medium than proper NuGet packages: Xenko 3.0 is still a monolithic single package and it would not work out of the box when referenced from Visual Studio without using Xenko Launcher and Game Studio.

trans-unit.source: Xenko 3.0 paved the way by making Xenko compatible with the new project system (game projects were referencing Xenko using a PackageReference).
trans-unit.target: Xenko 3.0 paved the way by making Xenko compatible with the new project system (game projects were referencing Xenko using a PackageReference).

trans-unit.source: GitHub
trans-unit.target: GitHub

trans-unit.source: Today, Xenko 3.1 brings Xenko as a set of smaller NuGet package, each containing one assembly, with proper dependencies:
trans-unit.target: Today, Xenko 3.1 brings Xenko as a set of smaller NuGet package, each containing one assembly, with proper dependencies:

trans-unit.source: GitHub
trans-unit.target: GitHub

trans-unit.source: As a result, it is now possible to create a game project that references only the packages you want. Here are a few examples of "core" packages:
trans-unit.target: As a result, it is now possible to create a game project that references only the packages you want. Here are a few examples of "core" packages:

trans-unit.source: Xenko.Engine: allows you to use core engine runtime (including its dependencies)
trans-unit.target: Xenko.Engine: allows you to use core engine runtime (including its dependencies)

trans-unit.source: Xenko.Core.Assets.CompilerApp: compile assets at build time
trans-unit.target: Xenko.Core.Assets.CompilerApp: compile assets at build time

trans-unit.source: Xenko.Core.Mathematics or Xenko.Graphics: yes, if you want to make a custom project only using Xenko mathematics or graphics API without the full Xenko engine, you can!
trans-unit.target: Xenko.Core.Mathematics or Xenko.Graphics: yes, if you want to make a custom project only using Xenko mathematics or graphics API without the full Xenko engine, you can!

trans-unit.source: Xenko.Core.Assets, Xenko.Presentation or Xenko.Quantum: all those piece of tech being used to build Xenko tooling are also available for reuse in other projects. Nothing prevents you from generating assets on the fly too!
trans-unit.target: Xenko.Core.Assets, Xenko.Presentation or Xenko.Quantum: all those piece of tech being used to build Xenko tooling are also available for reuse in other projects. Nothing prevents you from generating assets on the fly too!

trans-unit.source: Then, various parts of the engine are distributed as optional packages:
trans-unit.target: Then, various parts of the engine are distributed as optional packages:

trans-unit.source: If you don't reference those packages, they won't be packaged with your game either. In many situations, it results in a smaller packaged game and improved startup time.
trans-unit.target: If you don't reference those packages, they won't be packaged with your game either. In many situations, it results in a smaller packaged game and improved startup time.

trans-unit.source: Also, you are free to replace those functionalities with alternative libraries.
trans-unit.target: Also, you are free to replace those functionalities with alternative libraries.

trans-unit.source: Xenko assets are also distributed as part of package
trans-unit.target: Xenko assets are also distributed as part of package

trans-unit.source: NuGet packages have a xenko folder containing Xenko assets. As a result, user are able to generate nuget package containing Xenko assets out of the box from Visual Studio and publish them on NuGet for general consumption.
trans-unit.target: NuGet packages have a xenko folder containing Xenko assets. As a result, user are able to generate nuget package containing Xenko assets out of the box from Visual Studio and publish them on NuGet for general consumption.

trans-unit.source: Package layout: following best NuGet practices
trans-unit.target: Package layout: following best NuGet practices

trans-unit.source: Previously Xenko references were added to the project using custom targets.
trans-unit.target: Previously Xenko references were added to the project using custom targets.

trans-unit.source: New packages are now be layout as NuGet/Visual Studio expects them, in folders like lib/net45 and lib/monodroid10.
trans-unit.target: New packages are now be layout as NuGet/Visual Studio expects them, in folders like lib/net45 and lib/monodroid10.

trans-unit.source: We still have a few custom MSBuild targets but reduced them to minimum.
trans-unit.target: We still have a few custom MSBuild targets but reduced them to minimum.

trans-unit.source: Xenko Packages are now distributed on nuget.org
trans-unit.target: Xenko Packages are now distributed on nuget.org

trans-unit.source: With all those changes, it makes sense to stop distributing Xenko on our custom nuget server and use nuget.org instead.
trans-unit.target: With all those changes, it makes sense to stop distributing Xenko on our custom nuget server and use nuget.org instead.

trans-unit.source: This will greatly reduce friction to try Xenko (any project would work out of the box in Visual Studio). This might also make our launcher completely optional in the long run.
trans-unit.target: This will greatly reduce friction to try Xenko (any project would work out of the box in Visual Studio). This might also make our launcher completely optional in the long run.

trans-unit.source: Xenko tooling resolves assemblies dynamically using NuGet API
trans-unit.target: Xenko tooling resolves assemblies dynamically using NuGet API

trans-unit.source: Tools such as GameStudio or Asset Compiler are distributed as NuGet packages. However, it won't bundle Xenko Runtime, which will simply be encoded as dependency.
trans-unit.target: Tools such as GameStudio or Asset Compiler are distributed as NuGet packages. However, it won't bundle Xenko Runtime, which will simply be encoded as dependency.

trans-unit.source: When running those tools, they are resolving Xenko runtime assemblies directly in the NuGet cache.
trans-unit.target: When running those tools, they are resolving Xenko runtime assemblies directly in the NuGet cache.

trans-unit.source: This allows for distributing those tools as very small and easy-to-upgrade packages, avoiding file duplications. This is similar to what dotnet-cli is doing with deps file.
trans-unit.target: This allows for distributing those tools as very small and easy-to-upgrade packages, avoiding file duplications. This is similar to what dotnet-cli is doing with deps file.

trans-unit.source: This brings lot of technical challenges but should allow us in the future to be more flexible in the future to load the exact runtime and plugins that the user project reference rather than the one hardcoded with the tool.
trans-unit.target: This brings lot of technical challenges but should allow us in the future to be more flexible in the future to load the exact runtime and plugins that the user project reference rather than the one hardcoded with the tool.

trans-unit.source: Future: plugin support for editor
trans-unit.target: Future: plugin support for editor

trans-unit.source: Xenko 3.1 editor will still be monolithic: editor support for UI, SpriteStudio, Video and other optional modules will be hardcoded.
trans-unit.target: Xenko 3.1 editor will still be monolithic: editor support for UI, SpriteStudio, Video and other optional modules will be hardcoded.

trans-unit.source: However, the target is to get rid of them as soon as possible, and treat them as what they are: plugins.
trans-unit.target: However, the target is to get rid of them as soon as possible, and treat them as what they are: plugins.

trans-unit.source: Full switch to .NET Standard
trans-unit.target: Full switch to .NET Standard

trans-unit.source: Xenko supports .NET Standard for most of its runtime assemblies.
trans-unit.target: Xenko supports .NET Standard for most of its runtime assemblies.

trans-unit.source: Xenko games can run on .NET Core for both Windows and Linux.
trans-unit.target: Xenko games can run on .NET Core for both Windows and Linux.

trans-unit.source: Tutorials
trans-unit.target: Tutorials

trans-unit.source: Xenko now has a tutorial section in the documentation!
trans-unit.target: Xenko now has a tutorial section in the documentation!

trans-unit.source: The first project “C# Beginner”, demonstrates 12 beginner programming concepts.
trans-unit.target: The first project “C# Beginner”, demonstrates 12 beginner programming concepts.

trans-unit.source: Users will be able to select the tutorial template when creating a new Xenko project to practice and experiment with the code.
trans-unit.target: Users will be able to select the tutorial template when creating a new Xenko project to practice and experiment with the code.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, the code used in the project is directly referenced by the new documentation section which explains each individual tutorial level.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, the code used in the project is directly referenced by the new documentation section which explains each individual tutorial level.

trans-unit.source: The amount of tutorials, as well as intermediate and advanced tutorials, will be extended/added from now on.
trans-unit.target: The amount of tutorials, as well as intermediate and advanced tutorials, will be extended/added from now on.

trans-unit.source: BulletSharp update
trans-unit.target: BulletSharp update

trans-unit.source: Eideren worked on updating our old custom modified version of BulletSharp (the wrapper library we use for our physics engine).
trans-unit.target: Eideren worked on updating our old custom modified version of BulletSharp (the wrapper library we use for our physics engine).

trans-unit.source: Things should be much easier to maintain from now on.
trans-unit.target: Things should be much easier to maintain from now on.

trans-unit.target: This release also contains numerous improvements, bugfixes and new translations.
